definition[0]: to reach a final and definite agreement or decision about something
example[0]: Two days isn’t enough time to nail down the details of an agreement.
definition[1]: to force someone to say clearly what they want or what they intend to do
example[1]: Before they repair the car, nail them down to a price.
definition[2]: to force someone to say exactly what they want or what they intend to do
definition[3]: to reach a final and definite decision about something
example[2]: The US wants to nail down an agreement on anti-subsidy rules.
definition[4]: to make certain that you will get something
example[3]: The prospect of a shortage has U.S. companies rushing to nail down long-term supplies of critical parts.
example[4]: He sold the shares just because he thought it prudent to nail down a profit.
